title: 8 Easy Solutions to Fix Airpods Not Connecting to iPhone

steps.title: Check if Bluetooth is turned on.
steps.content: Check if Bluetooth is turned on. Open the Settings app and tap Bluetooth . Make sure the toggle is in the on position (green).

steps.title: Make sure your iPhone or iPad is updated.
steps.content: Make sure your iPhone or iPad is updated. Software updates include the latest bug fixes, so be sure your device is up-to-date. Do the following: Go to Settings . Tap General . Tap Software Update . Tap Download and Install .

steps.title: Place both AirPods in the case to charge.
steps.content: Place both AirPods in the case to charge. For best results, charge the case simultaneously, and let it charge for at least an hour. A low battery can prevent your AirPods from connecting successfully.

steps.title: If the AirPods are connected, make sure they are set as your audio device.
steps.content: If the AirPods are connected, make sure they are set as your audio device. Open the Control Center and tap the media square in the top-right corner. You should see the AirPods icon.

steps.title: Make sure only your AirPods are turned on and nearby.
steps.content: Make sure only your AirPods are turned on and nearby. If you have multiple devices synced to your iPhone or iPad, they may try to connect at the same time as your AirPods. Turn off any other devices or unpair them from your device temporarily.

steps.title: Turn your device off and on again.
steps.content: Turn your device off and on again. Whether you're trying to listen to your AirPods on your iPhone, iPad, or Mac, restart your device. This may help with connectivity issues on your device's end.

steps.title: Factory reset the AirPods
steps.content: Factory reset the AirPods . Put the AirPods back in the charging case and close the lid. Wait 30 seconds, and then put them in your ear. Check if they're connected to your device. [1] X Research source If the AirPods still aren't connected, put them back in the case, but leave the lid open. Press and hold the button on the back of the case for 15 seconds. The light indicator should turn amber and then white.

steps.title: If the AirPods still won't connect, contact Apple for help.
steps.content: If the AirPods still won't connect, contact Apple for help. This may be a hardware issue, and you may still be covered by Apple's warranty. [2] X Research source You can contact Apple on their website at https://getsupport.apple.com/ .
